intro: Anthistiria abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Anthistiria abyssinica is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes.
